code: glimpse(toy_temp) #> Rows: 990 #> Columns: 6 #> $ county_name      <chr> "Lyon County", "Dubuque County", "Crawford County", "… #> $ county_geometry  <MULTIPOLYGON [m]> MULTIPOLYGON (((274155.2 -1..., MULTIPOL… #> $ county_longitude <dbl> 306173.3, 746092.2, 381255.2, 696287.1, 729905.9, 306… #> $ county_latitude  <dbl> -172880.7, -239861.5, -318675.9, -153979.0, -280551.9… #> $ recorded_temp    <dbl> 21.08486, 28.94271, 26.39905, 27.10343, 34.20208, 20.… #> $ scientistID      <chr> "#74991", "#22780", "#55325", "#46379", "#84259", "#9… # Plot Raw Data ggplot(toy_temp) +   geom_sf(aes(geometry=county_geometry)) +   geom_jitter(aes(x=county_longitude, y=county_latitude, colour=recorded_temp),                width=5000, height =5000, alpha=0.7) # Mean data toy_temp_mean <- toy_temp |>    group_by(county_name) |>   summarise(temp_mean = mean(recorded_temp))     # Plot Mean Data ggplot(toy_temp_mean) +   geom_sf(aes(geometry=county_geometry, fill=temp_mean)) # Mean and variance data toy_temp_est <- toy_temp |>    group_by(county_name) |>   summarise(temp_mean = mean(recorded_temp),             temp_se = sd(recorded_temp)/sqrt(n())) # Distribution toy_temp_dist <- toy_temp_est |>    mutate(temp_dist = dist_normal(temp_mean, temp_se)) |>   select(county_name, temp_dist)   # Plot Distribution Data ggplot(toy_temp_dist) +   geom_sf_sample(aes(geometry=county_geometry, fill=temp_dist)) ggplot(toy_temp_dist) +    geom_sf_sample(aes(geometry = county_geometry, fill=temp_dist), linewidth=0.1) +    geom_sf(aes(geometry = county_geometry), fill=NA, linewidth=1)

title: Generates a bivariate palette — pal_bivariate
text: function creates bivariate palette, previously 1D colour palette can become 2D, allows variance mapped.

title: Generates a bivariate palette — pal_bivariate
text: colours character vector (length d) hex colours. type character highlight values transformed layers palette. Can one "desaturate", "lighten", "transparency". set "desaturate" default. n integer representing number times base colours transformed. .e. depth bivariate palette. amount integer representing amount desaturation, lightening, transparency base colour final colour palette (1 completely desaturated). Can also numeric vector length n provides amount desaturation occuring layer.

title: Generates a bivariate palette — pal_bivariate

title: Generates a VSUP palette — pal_vsup
text: function creates value supressed uncertainty palette 1D colour palette can transformed 2D palette allows variance mapped axis. Unlike bivariate palette, palette merges values.

title: Generates a VSUP palette — pal_vsup
code: pal_vsup(colours, method = "tree", type = "desaturate", n = NULL, amount = 0.9)

title: Generates a VSUP palette — pal_vsup
text: colours character vector (length d) Hex colours. method mixing method used combine colour values. Can set either "tree" (binary tree mix) "shrinkage" shrinkage mix. default set "tree". type character highlight values transformed layers palette. Can one "desaturate", "lighten", "transparency". set "desaturate" default. n integer representing number times base colours transformed mixed. .e. depth palette. amount integer representing amount desaturation, lightening, transparency base colour final colour palette (1 completely desaturated). Can also numeric vector length n provides amount desaturation occuring layer.
